00003 /*
00004  * Power Saturation function. Simply limits the motors' powers to given upper
00005  * and lower limits.
00006  */
00007 static inline
00008 F32 saturate (F32 sig, F32 lowerl, F32 upperl)
00009 {
00010         if (sig >= upperl) {
00011                 return upperl;
00012         } else if (sig <= lowerl) {
00013                 return lowerl;
00014         } else {
00015                 return sig;
00016         }
00017 }

00022 void disp (int row, char *str, int val)
00023 {

00025         display_string(str);
00026         display_int(val, 0);
00027         display_update();
00028 }

00030 /*
00031  * Function to compute the motors' average speed.
00032  */
00033 F32 avg(motor_t *mot)
00034 {
00035         U8 j;
00036         F32 sum = 0;
00037 
00038         for (j=0; j<SAMP_NUM; j++) {
00039                 sum += mot->speeds[j];
00040         };
00041 
00042         return (sum / SAMP_NUM);
00043 };
00044 
00045 //  Function to Update a Motor's Speed Readings.
00046 void update_speed (motor_t *mot)
00047 {
00048         S32 deltarev;   //  Delta value of the Motor's Revolutions
00049         S32 deltatime;  //  Delta value of the Motor's Sys Time
00050 
00051         //  Increasing Counters for the circular array
00052         mot->previous_counter = mot->counter;
00053         (mot->counter)++;
00054         if (mot->counter >= SAMP_NUM) {
00055                 mot->counter=0;
00056         };
00057 
00058         //  Getting last Revolution and Last System Time
00059         mot->revolutions[mot->counter] = nxt_motor_get_count(mot->port);
00060         mot->times[mot->counter] = systick_get_ms();
00061 
00062         //  Computing Deltas and then using them to get the instant speed
00063         deltatime = mot->times[mot->counter] - mot->times[mot->previous_counter];
00064         deltarev = mot->revolutions[mot->counter] -
00065                    mot->revolutions[mot->previous_counter];
00066         mot->speeds[mot->counter] = deltarev * 1000 /deltatime;
00067 
00068 };
00069 
00070 //  Function to Update a Motor's speed errors
00071 void update_errors (motor_t *mot)
00072 {
00073         //  Swapping Speed Errors
00074         mot->speed_errors[2] = mot->speed_errors[1];
00075         mot->speed_errors[1] = mot->speed_errors[0];
00076         //  Updating Last Speed Error
00077         mot->speed_errors[0] = mot->speed_ref - avg(mot);
00078 }
00079 
00080 //  Function to Update a Motor's powers. In here we use the PID Controller. :3
00081 void update_powers (motor_t *mot)
00082 {
00083         //  Swapping Motor's Powers
00084         mot->powers[2] = mot->powers[1];
00085         mot->powers[1] = mot->powers[0];
00086         //  Computing next power using the PID Controller
00087         mot->powers[0] = (K * ((4 + Ki * T * T + 2 * Kp * T) * mot->speed_errors[0] +
00088                                (-8 + 2 * Ki * (T * T)) * mot->speed_errors[1] +
00089                                (-2 * Kp * T + 4 + Ki * T * T) * mot->speed_errors[2]) +
00090                           (8 * mot->powers[1] - (-2 * P1 * T + 4) * mot->powers[2]))
00091                          / (2 * P1 * T +4); // OMG, Longest Formula EVAR!
00092         //  Saturating the result to the maximum and minimum power of the motor.
00093         mot->powers[0] = saturate(mot->powers[0],-100.0F,100.0F);
00094 }
